data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهَ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

data.meanings: But (after a negation); but not (after an affirmation).
data.sentence: The word وَلَكِنْ comes from the root ل ك ن and is associated with the meanings: But (after a negation); but not (after an affirmation).

data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.

data.meanings: To surpass in number or quantity, increase, multiply, happen often; To be much, many, numerous.
data.sentence: The word كَثِيرًا comes from the root ك ث ر and is associated with the meanings: To surpass in number or quantity, increase, multiply, happen often; To be much, many, numerous.

data.meanings: to do/make/act/work/operate/perform/construct/manufacture, practice a handcraft, be active, one who does.
data.sentence: The word تَعْمَلُونَ comes from the root ع م ل and is associated with the meanings: to do/make/act/work/operate/perform/construct/manufacture, practice a handcraft, be active, one who does.

data.meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.
data.sentence: The word يَعْلَمُ comes from the root ع ل م and is associated with the meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.

data.meanings: to cover/veil/conceal, veil/covering/curtain/screen, modesty, covered one, hide oneself.
data.sentence: The word تَسْتَتِرُونَ comes from the root س ت ر and is associated with the meanings: to cover/veil/conceal, veil/covering/curtain/screen, modesty, covered one, hide oneself.

data.meanings: told/gave information, to witness/see, to be present, give evidence/testimony, bear witness. mushhad - time or place of being present or of giving or hearing evidence, meeting place. mashhuud - that which is witnessed.
data.sentence: The word يَشْهَدَ comes from the root ش ه د and is associated with the meanings: told/gave information, to witness/see, to be present, give evidence/testimony, bear witness. mushhad - time or place of being present or of giving or hearing evidence, meeting place. mashhuud - that which is witnessed.
The word سَمْعُكُمْ comes from the root س م ع and is associated with the meanings: to hear, hearken, listen.

data.meanings: Becoming perceptive, mental perception, having belief or knowledge, understanding, intelligence or skill, knowing, giving light, shining, illuminated, making manifest, evident and/or apparent.To behold/perceive/see/observe/watch.Opening the eyes and/or seeing (seldom used unless mental perception is conjoined)Clear sightThickness of anythingSense of sight, making or causing to see and/or have sight, eye-sight, eyes.Soft stones having some whitenessIntent or a hard glanceA watcher or guard, a lion.
data.sentence: The word أَبْصَارُكُمْ comes from the root ب ص ر and is associated with the meanings: Becoming perceptive, mental perception, having belief or knowledge, understanding, intelligence or skill, knowing, giving light, shining, illuminated, making manifest, evident and/or apparent.To behold/perceive/see/observe/watch.Opening the eyes and/or seeing (seldom used unless mental perception is conjoined)Clear sightThickness of anythingSense of sight, making or causing to see and/or have sight, eye-sight, eyes.Soft stones having some whitenessIntent or a hard glanceA watcher or guard, a lion.

data.meanings: To hit/hurt/beat the skin, to strike, flog with a whip, fall down, to compel, to be hardy/strong/sturdy, to be enduring or patient, to contend with someone, constrain/compel/necessitate.
data.sentence: The word جُلُودُكُمْ comes from the root ج ل د and is associated with the meanings: To hit/hurt/beat the skin, to strike, flog with a whip, fall down, to compel, to be hardy/strong/sturdy, to be enduring or patient, to contend with someone, constrain/compel/necessitate.

data.meanings: To think, suppose, doubt, assume, deem, believe, know, imagine, suspect, conjunctive, be sure of something in view of one's observations. As a general rule often this verb is succeeded by 'anna or 'an, that means to be sure about.. . Zanna (prf. 3rd. p.m. sing, assim.): He thought, imagined, deemed, assumed, believed, conjectured, suspected; He was sure.. Zanantu (prf. 1st, p.m. sing.): I was sure.. Zannaa  (prf. 3rd. p.m. dual.): The twain thought.. Zannuu (prf. 3rd. p.m. plu.): They imagined.. Zanantum (prf. 2nd p.m. plu.): Ye thought.. Zananna (prf. 1st. p. plu.): We thought.. Yazunnu (imp. 3rd. p.m. sing.): He thinks.. Tazunnu (imp. 3rd. p. f. sing.): She thinks.. Azunnu (imp. 1st. P. sing.): I think.. Yazunnuuna (imp. 3rd, p. in. plu.): They know, believe, conjuncture.. Tazunnuuna (imp. 2nd. p.m. plu.): You entertained wrong thoughts.. Nazunnu (imp. 1st. p. plu.): We deem.. Zannun/Zannan  (nom./acc.n.): Thinking; Conjecture.. Zunuuna (n. plu.): Diverse thoughts.. Zaanniina (act. pic. n. plu.): Entertainers of evil thought..
data.sentence: The word ظَنَنْتُمْ comes from the root ظ ن ن and is associated with the meanings: To think, suppose, doubt, assume, deem, believe, know, imagine, suspect, conjunctive, be sure of something in view of one's observations. As a general rule often this verb is succeeded by 'anna or 'an, that means to be sure about.. . Zanna (prf. 3rd. p.m. sing, assim.): He thought, imagined, deemed, assumed, believed, conjectured, suspected; He was sure.. Zanantu (prf. 1st, p.m. sing.): I was sure.. Yazunnu (imp. 3rd. p.m. sing.): He thinks.. Tazunnu (imp. 3rd. p. f. sing.): She thinks.. Azunnu (imp. 1st. P. sing.): I think.. Yazunnuuna (imp. 3rd, p. in. plu.): They know, believe, conjuncture.. Tazunnuuna (imp. 2nd. p.m. plu.): You entertained wrong thoughts.. Nazunnu (imp. 1st. p. plu.): We deem.. Zannun/Zannan  (nom./acc.n.): Thinking; Conjecture.. Zunuuna (n. plu.): Diverse thoughts.. Zaanniina (act. pic. n. plu.): Entertainers of evil thought..
